body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the US state of Arkansas:
examples: Hot Springs National Park is best known for the 47 hot springs that come out of the Hot Springs Mountain at an average 143° Fahrenheit.
The purpose of Hot Springs National Park is to protect its unique geothermal spring water and associated lands for public health, wellness, and enjoyment.
